subject: Critical Thinking
title: Pattern Recognition vs. Patternicity
description: One-minute skill: Pattern Recognition vs. Patternicity.

hook.text: You see a face in the clouds, a figure in the static, a message in random noise. Your brain can't stop.

buildup.text: Patternicity is the tendency to find meaningful patterns in meaningless data. Michael Shermer coined the term.

discovery.text: Evolution favored false positives. Thinking a rustling bush is a tiger keeps you alive even if it's just wind.

twist.text: But in the modern world, patternicity leads to superstition, conspiracy thinking, and bad stock market bets.

climax.text: True pattern recognition requires testing: does the pattern predict something new, or just explain the past?

punchline.text: A real pattern makes predictions. A false one just feels right.

quiz.question: What is patternicity?
options: Finding meaningful patterns in meaningless data
